Arbitration.definition: the process of resolving a dispute
Arbitration.origin: [Latin arbitratio , from arbitrari to judge, arbitrate, from arbiter onlooker, arbitrator]

final offer arbitration.definition: interest arbitration in which the arbitrator must accept or reject the final offer of any party and may not decide to compromise

grievance arbitration.definition: arbitration of a dispute over something in an existing collective bargaining agreement called alsocomparein this entry

interest arbitration.definition: arbitration of a dispute over the provisions to be entered in a new contract comparein this entry
